New Records: Suryakumar Yadav scored 68 runs, his second consecutive half-century in the tournament; David Miller and Aiden Markram scored half-centuries for South Africa
Key Match Events: South Africa's partnership between Aiden Markram and David Miller was crucial; Hardik Pandya dismissed Aiden Markram, breaking a dangerous partnership; Lungi Ngidi took important wickets including Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma
Pre-Game Insights: India opted to bat first; the match was a significant contest between two strong teams with mixed results in their previous encounters
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed frustration over missed chances; Virat Kohli focused on moving forward; Lungi Ngidi expressed pride in his performance and the team's win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a high-scoring encounter with key contributions from both teams; Suryakumar Yadav's batting was a highlight for India
Others: Playing XI: India - Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik, Ravichandran Ashwin, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohammed Shami, Arshdeep Singh; South Africa - Quinton de Kock, Temba Bavuma, Rilee Rossouw, Aiden Markram, David Miller, Tristan Stubbs, Wayne Parnell, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Lungi Ngidi, Anrich Nortje
